text: Chula Vista (; , due to its scenic location between the San Diego Bay and coastal mountain foothills) is the second largest city in the San Diego metropolitan area as well as the 7th largest city in Southern California. In 2020, 275,487 people lived in Chula Vista. ==Zones and Developments== ===Zones West of the 805=== * Northwest * West * Southwest * North Central * Downtown CV * Middle South * South Central * South * Otay * East * Middle East ===Developments/Areas East of the 805=== * Sweetwater Canyon * Terra Nova * Telegraph Canyon * Far East * Sunbow * Rancho Del Rey * Otay Ranch * Bonita Canyon * College Estates * Eastlake * San Miguel Ranch * Rolling Hills Ranch ==Economy== According to the city's 2021 Comprehensive Annual Financial Report, the top employers in the city are: # Employer Employees 1 Sweetwater Union High School District 3,703 2 Chula Vista Elementary School District 3,549 3 Sharp Chula Vista Medical Center 2,580 4 Southwestern College 1,450 5 Rohr Inc./Goodrich Aerospace 1,345 6 Walmart 1,180 7 City of Chula Vista 1,149 8 Scripps Mercy Hospital Chula Vista 1,073 9 Costco 815 10 Aquatica 610 ==Transportation== ===Local area freeways=== Local area freeways in within the city of Chula Vista include * Interstate 5 * Interstate 805 * State Route 54 * State Route 125 ===Arterial streets=== East-West arterials *"C" Street *"E" Street-Bonita Rd(East of Flower Street) *"H/East H Street(East of Hilltop)-Proctor Vly Road(East of Mount Miguel) *"J/East J Street(East of Hilltop) *"L"/East L Street(East of Hilltop)-Telegraph Cyn Rd-Otay Lakes Rd *Naples/E.Naples(East of Hilltop) *Palomar/E.
